{{unnamed}}
'''Lord of the Iron Hills''' was probably the title given to the rulers of the [[Iron Hills]] in eastern  [[Rhovanion|Wilderland]]. The only two known Dwarves who probably held this title were [[Grór]]<ref>{{App|Durin}}, entry for Grór, p. 1072</ref> and his grandson and successor [[Dáin Ironfoot|Dáin II Ironfoot]]<ref>{{App|Durin}}, The Line of the Dwarves of Erebor, dates of death of Grór, Náin and Dáin II, p. 1079</ref><ref group=note>Grór's son [[Náin]] died in the [[Battle of Azanulbizar]] in {{TA|2799}}, six years before Grór's death in {{TA|2805}}.</ref>. In a council immediately before the [[Battle of the Five Armies]] in {{TA|2941}} after which Dáin became [[King under the Mountain]]<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2941, p. 1089</ref> and [[Kings of Durin's Folk|King of Durin's Folk]]<ref>{{App|Durin}}, The Line of the Dwarves of Erebor, * before Dáin II, p. 1079</ref>, Dáin was referred to as a "dwarf-lord"<ref>{{H|Burst}}</ref>. It is not known if anyone else took up the title of Lord of the Iron Hills after Dáin became a king. 

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2018: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:During the reign of [[Thorin Stonehelm]], his brother, "Náin the Slakeless", is Lord of the Iron Hills. He rules from the capital, "Járnfast".
